## FormatNumberSpecialFlag type

Defines special behavior for [formatNumber](./bitburner.ns.formatnumber.md)<!-- -->. See [FormatNumberOptions](./bitburner.formatnumberoptions.md)<!-- -->.

"integer": Formats the number as an integer. Ignores fractionalDigits if the number is below the suffixStart. This is how e.g. skills or hp are displayed ingame.

"percent": Formats the number as a percent. Never collapses to a suffixed form.

"ram": Formats the number as an amount of ram. Ram is always suffixed.

**Signature:**

```typescript
type FormatNumberSpecialFlag = "integer" | "percent" | "ram";
```
